Start with Photoshop.
Amazing will follow.

With Photoshop and generative AI, you can create gorgeous photos, rich graphics, and incredible art. Now available for commercial use.

Plans starting free for 3 months.

View Demo
Download now

Reimagine reality with creative composites.

Photographer Omi Kim transforms Kyoto cityscapes into dreamscapes using masks and layers that combine elements from different images.

Watch Omi blend elements to create his cinematic street scenes.

Effortless image editing with AI.

Blend photos and graphics, mash-up multiple landscapes, swap skies, transfer colors, or change someone’s age, expression, or pose — all in a few clicks. With AI-powered features, you can make amazing image edits in seconds and keep your creativity flowing.

See how Sky Replacement reimagines this landscape by photographer Lukas Furlan.

Pick up a brush and unleash your inner artist.

Illustrator and artist Beatriz Ramo ​uses Photoshop brushes and layers to add color, texture, and surreal effects to her hand-drawn portraits.

Animate your artwork.

Graphic designer Anna Mills uses layers, textures, and the timeline to create digital animations in a twitchy stop-motion style that feels analog.

Find out how Anna created this animated, revolving poster GIF.

Create anywhere with Photoshop on the iPad.

Take Photoshop with you and create using your finger or Apple Pencil. Layers, masks, brushes, spot healing, blend modes —they’re all right at your fingertips.

Explore Photoshop features.

Instantly expand images.

Click and drag beyond the borders of an image with the Crop tool, then use Generative Expand to fill the extended canvas with new content that blends with the existing image.

Edit images with generative AI.

Make complex edits in a flash with Generative Fill. Use simple text prompts to add and remove content from images.

Crop an image.

Select part of an image with the Crop tool and remove everything outside the selected area, or pair it with Generative Expand to extend the image.

Combine images.

Create a composite of two or more images by placing them on their own independent, transparent layers.

Add text to images.

Incorporate words into your photos and images to create eye-catching designs.

Make imperfections vanish.

Click and drag the Spot Healing Brush tool over small objects or flaws in your image to remove them.

Edit images right in your browser.

Add, remove, or expand content in images online with Photoshop on the web. Upload and edit multiple file types, explore tutorials, and more.

Apply filters for a new look.

Use over 30 new Adjustment Presets to dramatically change images. Hover to preview, click to apply, then tweak the results to make it unique.

Make large objects disappear.

Brush over or circle around a large shape with the Remove tool to fill it with content that matches the background, creating seamless edits.

Edit with next-step suggestions.

Click on features right in the Contextual Task Bar, a floating menu that displays next tasks based on what you’re doing and expedites masking and generative AI workflows.

Add and edit gradients on-canvas.

Use live preview and on-canvas controls to perfect the color and blend before applying them to your images with the improved Gradient tool.

Get feedback in-app.

Send a link to your work with Share for Review so anyone can view it and leave comments in your files — no sign-in needed. Respond to feedback and send updates to the same link, all in-app.

Yes, you can use Photoshop to edit videos. Learn more about video editing in Photoshop.

Photoshop is only available as part of a Creative Cloud plan, which includes the latest features, updates, fonts, and more.

You can sign up for a View Demo of Photoshop. Or create graphics, collages, flyers, videos, and animations for free with Adobe Express. For on-the-go creativity, you can install Photoshop Express on your smartphone for free.

There isn’t a free version of Photoshop on the web, however you can try out some of Photoshop’s most popular tools and uses online with the help of guided tutorials without creating an Adobe account. To upload and edit your own photos, you’ll have to sign up for a Photoshop plan or start a View Demo.

Yes, you can use Photoshop on the iPad. Find out more here.

Yes, students and teachers save over 60% on the Creative Cloud All Apps plan. Find out more here.

Generative AI features like Generative Fill and Generative Expand are natively integrated into Photoshop, combining the power of AI with the precision of Photoshop, so you can create more with complete control.
